column37: Read data that exceed usual time dimension (for past thousand year for exemple in netCDF counted in seconds, it does not fit in the actual format in 64 bits or something like this). Read HDF or gridded text files. Make interpolation directly with xESMF. Make easier taking into account the weights of latitudes/longitudes or days in months (it's already way better with .weighted() but does not work with all operations, like resample from what I remember). Try to take into account units, and raise warning about that. Same for time dimensions... it's easy to miss some days/months if we don't make a check by hand to count the number of months/days in the period we study (cause xarray, just ignore missing files and does not create index pour missing days/months with nans, so need to reindex and check that... it would be good to have some warning when data does not cover all time period, when opening with open_mfdataset).

column37: xr.open_mfdataset needs to be more memory efficient.  Currently looping on xr.open_dataset and building a list of xr datasets (slice data before adding to list) and then doing a final concatenation (xr.concat) is infinitely faster and uses less memory.  Unfortunately, it still requires reading/rereading the netcdf files in groups of 100 points, which is painful to repeat on data files with tens of thousands of grid points in them.
